I'm not a moderator (and this isn't a question) but my gut's telling me wikia is doing that to save on bandwidth. I can't imagine the KSP forums software is deciding to shrink down just wikia images.

> 
> 
> Just now, Superfluous J said:
> 
> 
> I'm not a moderator (and this isn't a question) but my gut's telling me wikia is doing that to save on bandwidth. I can't imagine the KSP forums software is deciding to shrink down just wikia images.
> 

wikia adds additional info in the URL, after the file extension, like https://........picture.jpg:blah-blah-resolution-etc

If remove that additional part, the picture is pictured in the KSP post.

Though, I've noticed that while previously a large picture was opened on click from the KSP post, now a thumbnail gets opened.  

Though 2: Maybe that's for some images, not for every one.
Hello, im not sure if mods can edit the forums. But theres no kerbal thinking emoji. Or someone who can, just please add a kerbal thinking emoji if you have permission to edit the forums lol
We will see what we can do.

Alright, got another question.  Not exactly mod based, but I need to know. KSP Blueprints, right, like the pictures? How are they made? I want to make them so bad! Are they drawn? Is there software? WHAT ARE THE SECRETS!?!

> 13 hours ago, Vanamonde said:
>

> In what way?
> 

Well, the front page doesn't display posts in **KSP[1] Expansions**, and the **KSP[1] Mods Discussions** and **KSP[1] Mod Development** subsubforums are missing. It's not the case when you click on **Kerbal Space Program [1]** and you arrive on a page where there's only the KSP1 subforums, in which case it's displayed normally. (see picture above)
The CMs have been tinkering a bit with forum organization. Is that what you mean?

I do miss that old quickness to access the spots I want to go.
